title.narrative: Burma: Promoting Trade Union Membership Growth

description.narrative: The Solidarity Center helps Burmese labor federations and unions develop a strategic approach to organizing and building membership in the formal and informal sectors.

The Solidarity Center provides training for workplace-level union leaders and activists in several industries and workplaces, which helps unions determine short- and long-term membership growth goals, build outreach and organizing strategies, coordinate recruitment efforts, use data to support outreach, communicate with workers, and build on best practices for union organizing in the region. Industries include food and beverage manufacturing, garment and textile manufacturing, mining, and hotels and tourism, as well as informal sectors such as agriculture, aquaculture, and transportation. Since the 2011 passage of the Labor Organizations Law, which granted Burmese workers limited rights to organize trade unions for the first time in 50 years, workers have organized and registered more than 1,500 local or workplace-level unions.
